schemaobjects.table¶

Functions¶

schemaobjects.table.column_schema_builder(table)¶

loads the list of columns in the table to .columns Field, Type, Null, Key, Default, Extra

IGNORE KEY, PRIVILEGES, MAYBE COMMENT or eq could be false negative

schemaobjects.table.foreign_key_schema_builder(table)¶
Loads all the foreign keys for a given table
schemaobjects.table.index_schema_builder(table)¶
This class should be a generator that yields a new index
schemaobjects.table.table_schema_builder(database)¶
Load the tables from a mysql database

Classes¶

class schemaobjects.table.OrderedDict¶

Bases: dict

A Dictionary whose items are returned in the order they were first added

clear()¶
D.clear() -> None. Remove all items from D.
copy()¶
D.copy() -> a shallow copy of D
static fromkeys()¶
dict.fromkeys(S[,v]) -> New dict with keys from S and values equal to v. v defaults to None.
get()¶
D.get(k[,d]) -> D[k] if k in D, else d. d defaults to None.
has_key()¶
D.has_key(k) -> True if D has a key k, else False
items()¶
iteritems()¶
iterkeys()¶
itervalues()¶
D.itervalues() -> an iterator over the values of D
keys()¶
next()¶
pop()¶
D.pop(k[,d]) -> v, remove specified key and return the corresponding value If key is not found, d is returned if given, otherwise KeyError is raised
popitem()¶
D.popitem() -> (k, v), remove and return some (key, value) pair as a 2-tuple; but raise KeyError if D is empty
setdefault()¶
D.setdefault(k[,d]) -> D.get(k,d), also set D[k]=d if k not in D
update()¶
D.update(E, **F) -> None. Update D from E and F: for k in E: D[k] = E[k] (if E has keys else: for (k, v) in E: D[k] = v) then: for k in F: D[k] = F[k]
values()¶
D.values() -> list of D’s values
